TEXT: e1: For dog dirt left on the pavement dog owners should by all means pay a bit more.
CN RELATION: dog dirt, left on the pavement (ReceivesAction)/dog dirt, pavement (AtLocation)/dog owners, pay (CapableOf)/dog dirt, paid for (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e2: Indeed it's not the fault of the animals,
e3: but once you step in it, their excrement seems to stick rather persistently to your soles.

MISSING INFORMATION 1: Dogs bear no responsibility for their dog dirt.
CN RELATIONS 1: dogs, responsible for dog dirt (NotHasProperty)/dog, dog dirt (Causes)
MISSING INFORMATION 2: Dog owners are responsible for their dogs.
CN RELATIONS 2: dog owners, responsible for their dogs (HasProperty)/dog owners, dogs (HasA)
MISSING INFORMATION 3: Dog owners are therefore responsible for removing the dog dirt.
CN RELATIONS 3: dog owners, responsible for removal of dog dirt (HasProperty)/dog dirt, removed (ReceivesAction)/dog owners, removing dog dirt (CapableOf)

MISSING INFORMATION 2: If you ask dog owners to pay for leaving dog dirt, there will be fewer dog dirt to step into.
CN RELATIONS 2: dog owners, leaving dog dirt (CapableOf)/dog owners, pay (CapableOf)/leaving dog dirt, pay (Causes)/pay for leaving dog dirt, fewer dog dirt (Causes)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: It is not the fault of the animals that they produce excrements.
CN RELATIONS 1: animals, fault (NotHasA)/dogs, produce excrements (CapableOf)/produce excrements, fault (NotIsA)
